topic.title: Creating tags for cards or pages

section.title: Introduction
section.p: Tags are a great way to dynamically group related cards or pages in Mingle.
You can create and manage tags from the Project admin tab, Tags link or create tags on the fly from within cards and pages.
section.hint: It's not essential to create tags as a project administrator since team members will most likely create tags as they work on projects. Your main task as a project administrator then becomes maintaining tags.
section.p: Applying tags to pages gives you extra search terms. Whenever you search in Mingle, the search results for pages are prioritized according to tags. For example, if a page has a tag of 'training' and you perform a Mingle search for 'training', this page will be prioritized in the search results.

Applying tags to cards gives you another layer of card filtering when displaying cards or creating saved views. You can specify which cards you want to view according to their tags from the Filter list by... sidebar control.
For details about creating tags in cards or pages on the fly, see Working with tags.

section.title: How to add new tags from the Project admin section

item.p: Sign in to Mingle as a project administrator and open the project with the tags you want to add or change (if you're not already working in the project).
Mingle displays the Project settings page. (Note: if you are signed in as a project team member, Mingle displays the Team page.)
Mingle displays the Tags page with all tags currently in the project. In the example below, no tags have been added yet.
Click the Create new tag link.
Mingle displays the Create new tag page.
Type the tag name. Do not include commas. You can add spaces for tags with more than one word.
Mingle saves the tag and displays it in the Tags page.

item.note: You can edit or delete tags using the Edit and Delete links in the Tags page.
